item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 26, 2025 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Hard numbers in the Wayland vs. X11 input latency discussion (230 points | 116 comments)
2. Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct-1M and Qwen2.5-14B-Instruct-1M (40 points | 10 comments)
3. Reviving a Dead Audio Format: The Return of ZZM (35 points | 3 comments)
4. It's not a crime if we do it with an app (710 points | 436 comments)
5. The Protesters' Guide to Smartphone Security (140 points | 60 comments)
6. Steam Brick: No screen, no controller, just a power button and a USB port (760 points | 216 comments)
7. 100 years of Bell Labs [pdf] (26 points | 2 comments)
8. DeepSeek-R1: Incentivizing Reasoning Capability in LLMs via RL (1079 points | 899 comments)
9. Paxo: A DIY Phone (106 points | 25 comments)
10. So you wanna write Kubernetes controllers? (14 points | 1 comment)
11. Former tech CEO suing to get the record of his arrest removed from the internet (15 points | 2 comments)
12. Show HN: SimpleSearch – Just a list of search bars (7 points | 12 comments)
13. Using the most unhinged AVX-512 instruction to make fastest phrase search algo (23 points | 3 comments)
14. OpenRA – Classic strategy games rebuilt for the modern era (550 points | 102 comments)
15. Render raises $80M in Series C financing (47 points | 41 comments)
16. No Bitcoin ETFs at Vanguard? Here's why (274 points | 353 comments)
17. Qwen2.5-1M: Deploy Your Own Qwen with Context Length Up to 1M Tokens (8 points | discuss)
18. AI slop, suspicion, and writing back (167 points | 127 comments)
19. Show HN: Orange intelligence, an open source alternative to Apple Intelligence (10 points | discuss)
20. The South Vietnamese pilot who landed a Cessna on a carrier to save his family (2019) (310 points | 152 comments)
21. Austin rents have fallen for nearly two years. Here's why (40 points | 28 comments)
22. YC Graveyard: 821 inactive Y Combinator startups (303 points | 179 comments)
23. Explainer: What's R1 and Everything Else? (189 points | 82 comments)
24. Every HTML Element (419 points | 123 comments)
25. I Built an Omni-Directional Ball-Wheeled Bike [video] (71 points | 9 comments)
26. An invalid 68030 instruction accidentally allowed the Mac Classic II to boot (273 points | 51 comments)
27. SigNoz (YC W21) Is hiring back end engineers to build open-source Datadog ( | hide)
28. Apache Iceberg (170 points | 53 comments)
29. The Simplicity of Prolog (151 points | 74 comments)
30. Show HN: A new native app for 20 year old OS X (9 points | discuss)
